meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of government control or intervention in social and economic matters.
meanings.sent1: Her governmentalism led her to support policies that aimed to regulate the economy for the benefit of all.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, governmentalism plays a crucial role in shaping public policies and programs.
meanings.sent3: The comedic play highlighted the absurdity of extreme governmentalism by portraying a society where every decision was made by the government.
meanings.sent4: The heavy-handed governmentalism in the novel symbolized the loss of individual freedoms in the dystopian world.
meanings.sent5: The textbook vividly explained the concept of governmentalism through historical examples and case studies.

meanings.definition: The principles or practices of government.
meanings.sent1: Studying governmentalism helps us understand how different systems of governance operate.
meanings.sent2: The course on political science delves into the complexities of governmentalism around the world.
meanings.sent3: The children's book simplified the idea of governmentalism by using animals to represent different forms of government.
meanings.sent4: The art installation at the museum explored the fragility of governmentalism in times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the evolution of governmentalism throughout history.
